label: Columbia Records
overview: Dangerously in Love is Beyoncé's debut studio album. This album marked a shift in her career, as she began to move away from Destiny's Child and establish herself as a solo artist. Beyoncé also worked to establish herself as more than just as singer on this album, as she is credited as a co-writer, co-producer, and executive producer. This album contains a variety of mid-tempo and ballad songs that fit into the R&B and soul genre. Though Beyoncé had a hard time gaining support from record executives for this album, it became a huge success, commercially and critically. This is the album that set Beyoncé on the path to becoming the dominating force in the music industry that she is today.

extras.extra1: Dangerously in Love debuted as number one on the US Billboard 200 chart.
extras.extra2: As of June 2016, Dangerously In Love is Beyoncé's best-selling album.
extras.extra3: At the 46th Annual Grammy Awards in 2004, Beyoncé won five awards for  Dangerously in Love. She won Best Female R&B Vocal Performance, Best R&B Vocal Performance by a Duo or a Group with Vocals, Best R&B Song, Best Contemporary R&B Album, and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration.
extras.extra4: Dangerously in Love is 4x Platinum certified in the United States, and has sold over 5,000,000 units in the United States alone.

label: Columbia Records & Sony Urban
overview: B'Day is Beyoncé's second studio album. It was released on her 25th birthday on September 4, 2006. This album was completed in only three weeks, and was heavily inspired by Beyoncé's starring role in the musical movie Dreamgirls. This album was positively received  by critics, and won the Grammy Award for Best Contemporary R&B album in 2007. Beyoncé later released the B'Day Anthology Video Album that included thirteen music videos. The B'Day deluxe album was also released. This album included songs from the original album, as well as various Spanish versions, and remixes.

extras.extra1: B'Day was nominated for five Grammy Awards at the 49th Annual Grammy Awards in 2007. It was nominated for Best Contemporary R&B Album, Best Female R&B Vocal Performance (Ring the Alarm), Best R&B Song (Déjà Vu), Best Rap/Sung Collaboration (Déjà Vu), and Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical (The Freemasons club mix of Déjà Vu).
extras.extra2: In 2008, at the 50th Annual Grammy Awards, B'Day also received nominations for Record of the Year (Irreplaceable) and Best Pop Collaboration With Vocals (Beautiful Liar - Beyoncé and Shakira).
extras.extra3: B'Day was named the 41st best album since 1993 by Vibe Magazine in April 2013
extras.extra4: B'Day was placed on multiple 'Best Albums of the Year' lists from various organizations such as Entertainment Weekly, Spin, Vibe, and Allmusic.

label: Sony Music World & Columbia Records
overview: I Am...Sasha Fierce is Beyoncé's third studio album. This dual disc album was conceived  with the intentions of showing the different sides of Beyoncé's musical talent and artistry. The first disc, 'I Am...', features slow, ballad and R&B songs, while 'Sasha Fierce' features more up-tempo, electropop songs. While I Am...Sasha Fierce' received  mixed reviews from critics, it debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, making it Beyoncé's third number one debut. It has sold over eight million copies, and was nominated for seven Grammy Awards.

singles.single2: Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)

extras.extra1: I Am...Sasha Fierce was nominated for seven Grammy Awards at the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards in 2010.  It was nominated for Album of the Year, Record of the Year (Halo), Song of the Year (Single Ladies), Best Female Pop Vocal Performance (Halo), Best Female R&B Vocal Performance (Single Ladies), Best R&B Song (Single Ladies), Best Contemporary R&B Album, and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration (Ego -Beyoncé and Kanye West ). Beyoncé won every award except Album and Record of the Year.
extras.extra2: In addition to award from the album, Beyoncé won an additional Grammy for her cover of 'At Last'. Her total of six awards broke the record for most wins by a female artist in one night.
extras.extra3: I Am...Sasha Fierce was the tenth best selling album of 2008.
extras.extra4: In 2009, I Am...Sasha Fierce was the second best-selling album in the US.

label: Parkwood Entertainment & Columbia Records
overview: 4 is Beyoncé's fourth studio album. After the release of her third album, and world tour, Beyoncé took a hiatus from music in 2010. During this hiatus, she also severed professional ties with her father and manager, who had been managing her career since her Destiny's Child days. This change resulted in 4, which is an album that was more personal than any of the ones to come before. 4 stepped away from the heavy R&B focused albums of the past and incorporated different styles such as funk, soul, and hip hop.  4 was received positively by critics.

extras.extra1: Love On Top, a single from the album, won Best Traditional R&B Performance Award at the 55th Annual Grammy Awards in 2013.
extras.extra2: At the Billboard Music Awards in 2012, 4 won Best R&B album.
extras.extra3: Once again, 4 debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart. This was Beyoncé's fourth consecutive number one debut.
extras.extra4: 4 was released by Beyoncé's entertainment and management company, Parkwood Entertainment.

label: Parkwood Entertainment & Columbia Records
overview: Beyoncé is Beyoncé's fifth, self-titled album. It was released on December 13, 2013 in a way that completely changed the music industry, and has continue to influence the way artists release albums today. Beyoncé was a surprise album that was dropped at midnight with no prior promotion or word that an album was coming. This album also included a video component, with an accompanying music video for each song. Beyoncé was critically acclaimed for its boldness in production and lyrical content.

extras.extra1: Though it was released in December, Beyoncé still made it onto multiple Album of the Year lists.
extras.extra2: Spin Magazine named Beyoncé the best R&B album of the year.
extras.extra3: Beyoncé was nominated for five Grammy Awards at the 57th Annual Grammy Awards in 2015. It was nominated for Album of the Year, Best Urban Contemporary Album, Best Surround Sound Album, Best R&B Song (Drunk in Love) and Best R&B Performance (Drunk in Love). The album won Best Surround Sound Album, Best R&B Song, and Best R&B Performance.
extras.extra4: Beyoncé was awarded the Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award at the 2014 MTV Video Music Awards for this album. The Video Vanguard Award, which is also known as the Lifetime Achievement Award, is awarded to an artist that has had great impact and influence with use of visual elements in their work.

label: Parkwood Entertainment & Columbia Records
overview: Lemonade is Beyoncé's sixth studio album, and second video album. The album was released on April 23, 2016 as an hour long film special on HBO. Lemonade was notable for its variety of songs, as Beyoncé incorporated rock, reggae, blues, hip-hop, gospel, and country elements into the album. The film that accompanied the album included spoken word poetry from Somali poet Warsan Shire, and was divided into 11 different chapters; Intuition, Denial, Anger, Apathy, Emptiness, Accountability, Reformation, Forgiveness, Resurrection, Hope, and Redemption. This album was critically acclaimed, and has gained recognition for being a politically charged celebration of black womanhood. The film featured many references to iconic moments and pieces of black culture, such as referencing the Igbo Landing and the movie Daughters of the Dust. Lilly Workneh of The Huffington Post called Lemonade 'a powerful ode to black women everywhere,' and Miriam Bale of Billboard said that Lemonade 'is a revolutionary work of black feminism.'

extras.extra1: Lemonade, the film, was nominated for four Primetime Emmy Awards in 2016. It was nominated for Outstanding Directing for a Variety Special, Outstanding Picture Editing for a Variety Programming, Outstanding Variety Special, and Outstanding Production Design for a Variety, Nonfiction, Event, or Award Special.
extras.extra2: Lemonade received five star ratings from multiple organizations, including Rolling Stone, The Independent, and The Daily Telegraph.
extras.extra3: At the 59th Annual Grammy Awards in 2017, Lemonade was nominated for nine awards. It was nominated for Record of the Year (Formation), Song of the Year (Formation), Album of the Year, Best Pop Solo Performance (Hold Up), Best Rock Performance (Don't Hurt Yourself - Beyoncé featuring Jack White), Best Urban Contemporary Album, Best Rap/Sung Performance (Freedom - Beyoncé featuring Kendrick Lamar), Best Music Video (Formation), and Best Music Film. It won Best Urban Contemporary Album, and Best Music Video.
extras.extra4: Rolling Stone, Billboard, Entertainment Weekly, The Guardian, The Independent, The Associated Press, The New York Times, Log Angeles Times, Complex, USA Today, NPR, and many other news organizations named Lemonade as the best album of 2016.

disclaimer: At this time, Lemonade is a Tidal exclusive, and unfortunately cannot be included in this project. When, and if, the album is uploaded to Spotify, this project will be updated accordingly.
